analyzedInstructions.name: Ingredients3 to 4 pounds boneless country-style pork ribs, cross cut in 1-1/2-inch pieces3 tablespoons prepared black bean garlic sauce from a jar (i.e. Lee Kum Kee)1/4 cup low-sodium soy salt1/4 cup mirin or chicken stock1 tablespoon honey1 tablespoon freshly grated ginger root1 tablespoon coarsely chopped fresh garlic1/2 teaspoon coarsely cracked black pepper1 tablespoon cornstarch2 teaspoons dark sesame oil1/4 cup + 2 tablespoons chopped scallions (white and tender green)Directions

steps.step: Spray interior of slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray.
Place pork cubes in slow cooker.
Combine black bean garlic sauce, soy sauce, mirin, honey, ginger, garlic, pepper and cornstarch in a small bowl; stir to dissolve cornstarch.
Pour over ribs.
Cook, covered, on LOW setting for 5 to 6 hours until ribs are tender but still hold their shape.

Transfer ribs to a rimmed serving platter; tent with foil to keep warm. Strain liquid into a small pan. Bring liquid to a boil over medium-high heat; cook until mixture begins to thicken and is reduced by half. Stir in sesame oil.
Add sauce and 1/4 cup scallions to pork cubes.
Mix well.
Garnish with reserved 2 tablespoons scallions.
